title: Job 19:1
text: THEN Job answered and said,

title: Job 19:2
text: How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?

title: Job 19:3
text: These ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me.

title: Job 19:4
text: And be it indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.

title: Job 19:5
text: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach:

title: Job 19:6
text: Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.

title: Job 19:7
text: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.

title: Job 19:8
text: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.

title: Job 19:9
text: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.

title: Job 19:10
text: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.

title: Job 19:11
text: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.

title: Job 19:12
text: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.

title: Job 19:13
text: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.

title: Job 19:14
text: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.

title: Job 19:15
text: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.

title: Job 19:16
text: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.

title: Job 19:17
text: My breath is strange to my wife, though I intreated for the children's sake of mine own body.

title: Job 19:18
text: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.

title: Job 19:19
text: All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.

title: Job 19:20
text: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.

title: Job 19:21
text: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.

title: Job 19:22
text: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

title: Job 19:23
text: Oh that my words were now written!  oh that they were printed in a book!

title: Job 19:24
text: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!

title: Job 19:25
text: For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth:

title: Job 19:26
text: And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God:

title: Job 19:27
text: Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another; though my reins be consumed within me.

title: Job 19:28
text: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?

title: Job 19:29
text: Be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.
